definitions.definition: A facial expression in which the eyebrows are brought together, and the forehead is wrinkled, usually indicating displeasure, sadness or worry, or less often confusion or concentration.
A facial expression in which the corners of the mouth are pointed down.
To have a frown on one's face.
definitions.example: She frowned when I told her the news.

definitions.definition: To manifest displeasure or disapprobation; to look with disfavour or threateningly.
definitions.example: Noisy gossip in the library is frowned upon.

definitions.definition: To repress or repel by expressing displeasure or disapproval; to rebuke with a look.
definitions.example: Let us frown the impudent fellow into silence.
Frank frowned his displeasure with my proposal.
